isSatisfiable

public boolean isSatisfiable(boolean global)
                      throws TimeoutException
インタフェース IProblem の記述:
Check the satisfiability of the set of constraints contained inside the solver.

定義:
インタフェース IProblem 内の isSatisfiable
オーバーライド:
クラス SolverDecorator<T extends ISolver> 内の isSatisfiable
パラメータ:
global - whether that call is part of a global process (i.e. optimization) or not. if (global), the timeout will not be reset between each call.
戻り値:
true if the set of constraints is satisfiable, else false.
例外:
TimeoutException

isSatisfiable

public boolean isSatisfiable(IVecInt assumps,
                             boolean global)
                      throws TimeoutException
インタフェース IProblem の記述:
Check the satisfiability of the set of constraints contained inside the solver.

定義:
インタフェース IProblem 内の isSatisfiable
オーバーライド:
クラス SolverDecorator<T extends ISolver> 内の isSatisfiable
パラメータ:
assumps - a set of literals (represented by usual non null integers in Dimacs format).
global - whether that call is part of a global process (i.e. optimization) or not. if (global), the timeout will not be reset between each call.
戻り値:
true if the set of constraints is satisfiable when literals are satisfied, else false.
例外:
TimeoutException

isSatisfiable

public boolean isSatisfiable(IVecInt assumps)
                      throws TimeoutException
インタフェース IProblem の記述:
Check the satisfiability of the set of constraints contained inside the solver.

定義:
インタフェース IProblem 内の isSatisfiable
オーバーライド:
クラス SolverDecorator<T extends ISolver> 内の isSatisfiable
パラメータ:
assumps - a set of literals (represented by usual non null integers in Dimacs format).
戻り値:
true if the set of constraints is satisfiable when literals are satisfied, else false.
例外:
TimeoutException

internalState

public void internalState()
In the internal state, the solver will allow the selector variables to be satisfied. As such, the solver will answer "true" to isSatisfiable() on an UNSAT problem. it is the responsibility of the user to take into account the meaning of the selector variables.

externalState

public void externalState()
In external state, the solver will prevent the selector variables to be satisfied. As a consequence, from an external point of view, an UNSAT problem will answer "false" to isSatisfiable().
